alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 9:41PM EDT until March 26 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 6.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall to 5.9 feet and begin rising again Thursday evening. It will rise above flood stage Thursday night and continue to rise to 7.5 feet Friday. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.5 feet on 03/31/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Rifle River Sterling 6.0 5.8 Tue 9 pm EDT 5.9 7.2 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
